text: Room Was Acceptable
The internet access from the room was $9.95 for a 24 hour period.
To check in for my flight using the business center cost me $4.59 which included three minutes use of the internet and printing seven pages for my boarding pass.
Staff was very pleasant and helpful.
Great stay!
What a wonderful choice.
Check in was fast and courteous.
Food was outstanding, for both the conference and on my own.
Pool was refreshing on the hot days.
I will definitely stay here again conference or not.
Good Business Hotel
Very nice hotel for business travelers - very few kids.
I had excellent shuttle service.
The only downside was a per minute charge to use the business center computers.
Perfectly Close to the Airport
I booked this because of it's proximity to the airport for our departure.
The staff was friendly and helpful, they upgraded our room to queen beds without us asking.
The 24 hour shuttle to the airport is very, very convenient and gets you there in about 4 minutes.
A Great Hotel
Our stay at this hotel was wonderful.
The staff was very courteous upon check-in.
Our room was perfectly spotless.
(I had to use an outlet behind the headboard, and expected to see some type of dirt when I pulled the bed out, but to my surprise, not even dust!)
Some nice touches of southwest decor here and there.
No problems whatsoever, and I would recommend this hotel to anybody.
She immediately began to yell that if I wanted an upgrade I would have to pay for it.
The same desk clerk started to yell again stating that she had told me when I called that I could upgrade for a charge and that was her rules.
She completely ignored me and just kept on yelling.
I asked to speak to the manager and she told me she was the manager when in fact the manager's name was clearly displayed on the wall.
This incident was very humiliating as other guests were present.
I am writing this review because this kind of behavior was totally unacceptable and hopefully no other guests will be treated in this manner.
Not bad for one night
Front desk staff were friendly and helpful both with early check-in and an early check-out.
Ideal location.
Very affordable rate at low $50s.
Well below average
Unfortunately, this is below average.
The hotel shows its age and badly needs refurbishing.
Bathroom sink was on a slight slant because it was pulling out of the wall.
Nothing is especially terrible or unacceptable about this hotel.
It is just subpar.
Don't do it!!
The pictures they provide on the web do not tell the story so don't be fooled.
Great Restaurant
This property has really improved since our last stay.
The restaurant downstairs is the best kept secret in the area!
Staff was courteous and efficient.
I keep on coming back!
I've been going to this place every year and I keep on coming back to this hotel.
The breakfast is excellent!
It is rare that hotels in this class serve hot meals, yet they do!
Breakfast is fit for a king.
Plus, the staff at the front desk are always courteous and friendly.
And the hotel is right in the middle of everywhere.
Got a great price of $64 per night.
Close to Scottsdale and the University.
Price was right
Pleasantly surprised at $69 night.
Stayed there because it was near Banner Hospital.
Friendly Staff
The staff was extremely helpful and friendly.
I would say they are the best part of the hotel!
Administrative Issues
I've tried to obtain a receipt for my stay to replace one I lost and have been ignored.
It's not a recipe for another stay.
Not impressed
The desk person was in a rude mood.
There was construction being done on the street in front of the hotel; which made it very difficult driving around.
The air conditioner was very loud.
Nothing told us that there was a free breakfast - the restaurant looked like it was closed.
Excellent service.
The staff was friendly overall.
Airport shuttle service was convenient as I chose not to rent a car during this trip.
There was a few restaurants within walking distance to eat at as well.
The conference/banquet room was great.
Not sure where the location was in reference to tourist spots, etc....but for a local conference, it was perfect.
I cant complain about this hotel stay.
the location is in the central valley so getting to anywhere is easy with the easy access to the local freeways.
I would absolutely stay here again!!
I was pleasantly surprised.
The continental breakfast was excellent.
They seem to have businesspeople in mind.
Loved this hotel overall
We loved this hotel.
It was close to the airport.
The rooms were quiet.
Also 2 flat sceen tvs and lots of space in each room.
The only complaint I had is that our suite smelled like smoke and it was a non smoking suite.
We turned on both air conditioners to get rid of the smell and it wouldn't go away.
Understand the property is under new management and it really shows.
Recommend this highly for the seasoned Pheonix road warrior or warriorette.
No noise, though hotel was half empty I'm extremely sensitive to noise at hotels and was not disturbed both evenings or in the mornings.
Is an older building but appeared to be well maintained.
Exterior grounds well kept.
Has elevators on both sides of the building.
Hotel provides free pass to Golds Gym, a five minute walk from front door.
Staff was freindly and professional for the most part.
Has good airport shuttle, ten minutes unless heavy traffic, then at worst 20 minutes.
Its convienently located in southeast phoenix, right next to Tempe.
Nice neghborhood, safe.
Would stay again.
Good conference facilities too, set up well.
"best" Best Western
This hotel is the best Best Western I have stayed in.
Hotel desk staff was friendly.
Very comfortable room.
Two dificulties I had were: One, the restaurant service was terrible!
Then wait to give order, then wait for the food.
The food selection was pretty good.
One time the employee stopped to pick up dirty plates as he led me to my seat!
The other problem was the hotel manager - a young woman apparently somewhat new at her job.
She tried to refuse my gold crown club points as payment for my stay.
When I was persistent, she made a phone call and I heard her say well, i never heard of that.
I would definitely stay here again when in the Phoenix area!
- Comparatively inexpensive
- Microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker in room
- Nice staff
- Average room size.
- Very limited space to hang clothes
My biggest problem was the location.
It was far away from all the sites I wanted to see.
Great airport location
It was very quiet considering being so close to the airport.
The food in the Bar and Grille was just ok.
You can print boarding passes at a kiosk near the front desk but it can be busy first thing in the morning so you might want to do it the day before.
I left on the 7:00am shuttle and the ride to the airport was quick and hassle-free.
Excellent!
Wow! What a great hotel!
Beds were so comfortable!
Staff was friendly.
Pool was heated, had a great atmosphere with unlimited bottled water available while swimming/laying out.
Offered food and drink service at the pool.
Room service was great!
I had the southwestern ceasar - it was one of the best salads I've ever had!
I was very impressed and would come back to the HIlton Phoenix Airport again!
DO NOT STAY HERE
All 4 lower rooms were 80 degrees and above.
After the concert we had to change 4 of the rooms twice trying to find cooler floors.
We finally gave up at 12:30 a.m. with a room that was 77 degrees - still too warm.
And the room did not even have a shower curtain!
I understand they are going through renovations, but they need to either do it floor by floor and close that floor or close the entire hotel until finished.
Very disappointing
Lots of services promised and not provided.
Vending machines were out of everything except in the lobby.
Staff was very friendly and a bit embarrassed about everything that wasn't available.
The room itself was fine.
Pay extra and stay somewhere else
This has to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in!
Their was no HOT WATER!
The beds are very hard.
The staff was friendly.
No wifi only in the hotel lobby.
If you get a suite with a stove dont except dishes, pots and pans they do not provide them you have to buy your own.
Pay the 20 extra and stay somewhere's else
I had a great time at this hotel and did not experience any of what the bad reviews are about.
I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in downtown Phoenix.
